title: I GOT Permanently Banned ON league For Reporting someone and some hacker Put his email in my Account
body: I Cant see why I got banned because it wasn't a false report. This guy was calling me a douche bag and it hurt my feelings so I reported him for hate speech. Then I got perma banned. I couldn't check my email because some hacker changed it to  *****RKAT@HOTMAIL.COM. I can't change it because I don't know what the hell that email is. Can someone PLSSSSSS Help ME!!!!!

replies.body: You didn't get banned for reporting someone, it could've been a lock to prevent your compromised account from incurring any more damage (or something else, idk). You need to submit an [Account Recovery Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=72416). Refer to the [Recovering Your Account](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751694-Recovering-Your-Account) article for more information.

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oKj8Pxvg,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-11-05T19:22:30.199+0000)

> You didn't get banned for reporting someone, it could've been a lock to prevent your compromised account from incurring any more damage (or something else, idk). You need to submit an [Account Recovery Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=72416). Refer to the [Recovering Your Account](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751694-Recovering-Your-Account) article for more information.

This. Do this.

All you need to do is contact support. Accounts that a compromised are locked to protect the account for the owner. Much like stopping a credit card when mysterious charges start showing up.

The reporting and hate speech has nothing to do with your issue.

Nobody can hack your league account, and even if you gave them your passworld (the _only_ way accounts are ever stolen in games) they could not change the email linked to the account, since it is used for security/account retrieval.

You got wrecked, accept the wreck.
I Didnt Put an email in the first place and I think i got hacked by pressing on a link my friend gave me

Signing up without an email is impossible.

Clicking links cannot "hack" you. The only way you can loose your account is by voluntarily giving away your password, to a person or a website. (which is not hacking, just stupidity).

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oKj8Pxvg,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-05T19:30:55.043+0000)

> Signing up without an email is impossible.
> 
> Clicking links cannot "hack" you. The only way you can loose your account is by voluntarily giving away your password, to a person or a website. (which is not hacking, just stupidity).

Actually you can get hacked through links. It happened to me back in 2005 some random dude i'd just played with sent me a link for free "steam gift card" or something, and I clicked it thinking "lets see what this scam is" since I had the same idea as you back then that links to webpages can't steal account info. I got booted out of my account, and locked out in 3 minutes. Fortunately, Steam support is good about those kinds of problems, and I had my account back in a day.

I still don't know what exactly that link did, but it opened a blank page in my browser, so I initially shrugged it off as spam. Never trusted links from anyone who isn't a long standing friend since.

That said, I don't really believe this guy,

Ok, correction, it can happen - but only if you turn off every form of security in your computer and already have some serious vulnerabilities in your browser, from malware or bad addons.
It never _should_ happen. If it was that easy, nobody would be safe.

It is that easy, and my computer is more secure than the grand majority. Just because you've never on a whim clicked a link you knew was a scam for the lolz, like every add about miracle cures etc bs adds on the sides of webpages.

Only difference was this was a tiny url hiding malicious code, and not an actual dumb ad that leads you to a million surveys for a ps4.
URLs cannot contain executable code of any kind. Websites running scripts should not have any access to the computer, without preexisting security issues.
